result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Ernest King

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense, Attorney Nicholas Conrardy

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status of counsel.  No attorney appointed.  Court appoints Attorney Nicholas Conrardy at county expense.  Court ordered the defendant to reimburse the county at $50.00 a month starting January 1, 2023.  Court scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in for Status of Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant provided update regarding effort to retain Attorney. For reasons stated on the record Defendant requested Court appoint Attorney. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court will appoint Attorney at next hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Case remains calendared in branch 2.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant needs to contact Attorney Ritter. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Defendant requests more time to retain counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
At defendant's request, 08-05-2022 status conrference moved from 8:30 am to 1:30 pm

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for indigency hearing. Defendant is seeking to retain counsel. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel hearing, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court in person.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FP and CAK

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Jeffery Ernest King in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffery Ernest King appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
